description: The problem is that when attempting to use MonkeyPatching to make a difference in the runtime behavior of a program, the program throws an error due to an unexpected difference between the original code and the patched code. This difference causes the program to crash at runtime.
output:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 7, in <module>
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'original_function' referenced before assignment
